title: Residents of The Birches in Clarendon Hills waiting for Cubs World Series The Doings Clarendon Hills
text:
Betty Kuss would love just one more birthday present from the Chicago Cubs.
Kuss turned 100 years old Aug. 21, and has a letter of congratulations for reaching that milestone from Cubs owner Tom Ricketts proudly displayed in her apartment at the Birches Assisted Living in Clarendon Hills.
But now Kuss would also like to see the Cubs continue their winning ways this season, all the way to a World Series championship. The team hasn't won that title since 1908 and hasn't even played in a World Series since 1945.
"We're all waiting for it to happen," Kuss said. "I always wanted them to win, and I think it's going to happen now. I have confidence in the Cubs, and I love the Cubs; they're good, nice guys."
While Kuss said she doesn't have specific memories of the 1945 World Series, fellow Birches resident Shirley Petersen, 84, does.
"I went to a game in 1945, but they lost," she said. "I've been a real big Cubs fan since I was 12. My dad used to take me to the game, and when he stopped taking me I went by myself."
Petersen said a friend's brother was able to get tickets for the 1945 World Series game.
"I was very exciting, just being able to go and see the game like that," she said. "It's pretty exciting now, too. They were pretty bad for a few years before now, but I don't get discouraged."
Cubs fans at The Birches Chuck Fieldman / Pioneer Press Shirley Petersen, 84, is a huge Cubs fan and attended a World Series game at Wrigley Field in 1945. (Chuck Fieldman / Pioneer Press) Petersen said she had a few friends over to watch the Tuesday Oct. 14 game with some snacks and wine when the Cubs clinched the division series championship over the St. Louis Cardinals.
"I was pretty fidgety," she said. "I tell myself to take it easy and not get so excited, but it's hard because I really want them to go all the way."
Petersen said Peanuts Lowrey and Phil Cavarretta are her favorite Cubs players from the past. Her current favorite is Anthony Rizzo.
"Yeah, I really like him," she said. "He hits a nice ball."
Edna Mae Campbell, 93, is another Birches resident who has been enjoying watching the Cubs success this year.
"I've been a Cubs fan forever," she said. "Win or lose, I'm always a Cubs fan, and I always watch, even when they were losing."
While she watches the Cubs on TV, win or lose, Campbell is especially enjoying the success of the 2015 Cubs.
"It's been very exciting, and I think they're going to win the World Series," she said. "I think they'll win it because I want them to."
